meta.description: LuxxLounge at Frankfurt Airport (FRA), Terminal 1, Concourse B/C. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

location.terminalDirections: Landside, between Concourses B and C on the Gallery Level, next to the Travel Market (Reisemarkt).

general: Showers are accessible for free for guests who purchase access to the lounge. A 10 EUR charge is applicable for Priority Pass, Lounge Key, and Diners Club cardmembers.
warning: If coming from the Sheraton Hotel, proceed across the bridge into the lounge. Transit passengers must leave the transit area and go through immigration and customs to access the lounge.

reviews.content: Unhappy staff, hard to find, must leave security, small - very compact, dirty and old, half stuff is pork! no lounge wifi (using airport) charging plugs not working.Worst - management doesnt give damn
Very small and a bit old. Less food...
“Luxx Lounge” is anything but “Luxx”. Very little selection & messy bathrooms. Chairs are comfy, but very close together. Not worth a detour unless you’re getting in free & can’t get in elsewhere.
A bit outdated but quite lounge. Food selection could be bigger. It is located before security, so you have to plan your time well.
I would expect such a lounge somewhere in Central Africa, but not at an airport like FRA. Last investment was probably in the 1980's. Shabby, staff arguing loudly amongst each other. It's a disgrace!
Old and dilapidated, you're better off lounging at the gates. Open bar is clearly watered down alcohol. Food options minimal and of extremely low quality.
Good beverages. Very poor food. Quite comfortable.
It's meh... I went there during a very slow time. It's cool if you get to the airport early and want a drink and some snacks. Other than that not really worth it.
Crowded, too small, no privacy.
Crowded, no air conditioner, few hot food.
Extremely limited food and drink selection. No views. Bathroom often not clean. Inconveniently located outside of security.
Total dump. I'd rather hang out in the men's bathroom.
Great lounge, the amenities description should mention that there is a 5 euro charge to use the showers.
Very quiet and nice size, very comfortable chairs. Minimal food but nice none the less. Mix your own drink and take a quiet nap in the cozy chairs.
Delightful. Quiet. Spotlessly clean. Divided up into areas for some peace and relative privacy as opposed to the big "barns". Euro selection of basic foods, fresh juices, express or free Wi-Fi.
Seats comfortable but v. outdated design.Food offering is limited but coffee was quite good. Biggest pain is this is before passport and security so allow time to get to gate which at FRA can be long
Duschen kostenlos, wenn Eintritt direkt bezahlt. Kein Drucken. 2 Duschen, schnell frei, könnten sauberer sein (Haare vom Vorgänger o. Putzfrau?!) Kein Flugmonitor? 30 € Eintritt für 3 Std = Daypass?!
It is a good, quiet place to relax if you need to waste some time in Terminal 1. Chairs are comfortable. Seems slightly outdated. Would like more food choices. Overall, not too bad.
Not much to look at here, but definitely useful if you're in need of a shower, especially after arriving from an intercontinental flight. Otherwise, fairly small and very basic, but quiet.
Very cozy place. Small snack selection with good drinks. Only 2 showers available, but not busy.
Solid lounge. Decent, simple breakfast buffet - German cheeses and meats, pastries. Free pour booze.
Pretty basic lounge with poor selection of food. Comfortable environment. Biggest minus is it's on the landside.
Nice and quiet. Good food. Wifi. (OK, airport's)
Good service, not the best food and drink choices. It has an outdated vibe and is outside of security, making it inconvenient for connections.
No spectacular lounge but there is a standard range of food, drinks and a neat interior. It is hard to believe that you are right above the departure hall at one of Europe's largest airports.
Small and pretty basic lounge. Although showers are 5 euro, it can be an arrival lounge before you take the train.

Very poor, yet not many options if you are Priority Pass member and don't have access to other lounges. When visiting, it was very warm and no AC, food included few snacks and very limited selection of drinks.
A decent little lounge visited during a long airside stopover at FRA. Good food selection, fast internet and comfortable atmosphere. My only issue is that there is a €5 fee to use the showers.
Don't expect champagne, lots of food or even still water. The only hot food you get are sausages. Otherwise, the lounge is comfortable. So not worth it for the food but ok to relax, I guess.
Finding this lounge is a bit of an effort, it's outside security, which isn't convenient, but they had lots of space and great food offerings. Showers are 5Euro, but worth it!
A decent smallish lounge outside of security in terminal 1. Plenty of drinks (coffee, tea, soft drinks, beer, whisky, etc). Some snack type foods. Not much in the way of service but an OK lounge.
Nice lounge. Location is not ideal (outside security, within low-cost tour operators booths) but very clean and calm. Wifi OK.
The LuxxLounge offers good food, but  not much variety and different foods. There is enough seating, but i would like the seating to be more private.
Used the opportunity of a 7 hr layover to visit this lounge. Took me 5 mins to get to after exiting immigration. Paid €5 for shower. Took me 15 mins to get to my Z50 departure gate. Photos attached.
Good place, regular crowded, good wi-fi. Food is just ok. Drinks are better, including 2-3 types of beers.
Causy. A lot of drinks but less food. Shorts available at 5 EUR.
A small, outdated lounge that offers satisfactory food, drinks, and WiFi. Much better than United Lounges, in my opinion.
Service was great, and the food was acceptable. Unfrotunately, the bathrooms only have 2 stalls (no urinals), which were always occupied, despite the lounge being at 25% capacity.
This lounge has free WiFi and offers a lot of drinks! However, the shower booth is not free.
This is a cozy lounge that offers great snacks. The personnel is also very friendly.
This is a good lounge that's a bit low on service. However, it's still a good alternative to the gates.

location.terminalDirections: Next to Gate A13, Level 2, opposite the Duty Free Shop.
Near Gate A26, proceed one level up to the entrance.
Level 2, opposite the Duty Free Shop, next to Gate A13.
Level 2, opposite the Duty Free Shop, towards Gate A50.
Located behind Airport Entrance 13 (Tor 13) when arriving by car.
After Passport Control, proceed towards Gates B24-B28 and take the lift or stairs to the lounge entrance.
After Passport Control, proceed towards Gates B44-B48 and take the lift or stairs to the lounge entrance.
Departure Area B, next to Gate B22.
Departure Area B, opposite Gate B42, next to Gate B43.
Outside of Passport Control and Security Checkpoint, Arrival Area B, immediately behind the Baggage Claim.
After Passport Control but before final Security Checkpoint, Departure Area C, near Gates C14-C15.
After Passport Control but before final Security Checkpoint, Departure Area C, near Gate C14 and Gate C15.
Level 4, opposite the Duty Free Shop towards Gate Z50.
Level 3, opposite the Duty Free Shop towards Gate Z50.
